title: A. LEE PARSONS

title: LOUIS BERNSTEIN
firstSentence: Louis Bernstein, a teacher and principal in the New York City school system for more than 50 years until his retirement in 1964, died of a heart attack Monday at his home in Hollywood, Fla.

Ridgway in 1952 when General Ridgway was Supreme Commander of the Allied Powers in Europe and was Army liaison with the White House under President Truman, died Thursday in Clearwater, Fla. General Beishline, who was 78 years old, lived in Greenwich, Conn., and had a winter home in Clearwater.

title: GEORGE MATHEWS, 73, ACTOR ON BROADWAY AND IN MOVIES
firstSentence: George Mathews, an actor who had a long career that took him from the classics to gangster roles, died of heart disease Wednesday.

title: James Fuld, 91, Dies; Collected Sheet Music

title: Vivian Cadden, 78, Writer and Editor

title: Jerry Heller, 75, Promoter of N.W.A and Gangsta Rap

title: Dzevad Mujezinovic, Diplomat And Ex-Belgrade Envoy to U.S.

title: Clarence Johnson Is Dead at 80; A Top Aircraft Designer in U.S.
